_description: This is the schema for a Triad Engine domain guide. Fill in each section for your target domain. The Rome guide used in this benchmark is proprietary — this file shows the structure you need to replicate it for your own domain.

time_period_context._description: What moment in time / context are we locked to?
time_period_context.summary: One sentence describing the current state of the domain

anachronisms_to_avoid._description: What does NOT exist yet in this domain? This is the core hallucination-prevention list.
not_yet_happened: Example: Fall of Western Rome (476 CE)
technology_notes: Example: No paper — only papyrus and wax tablets
Example: No stirrups, gunpowder, or printing press

timeline_recent_events.event: Trajan became emperor after Nerva's death
Dacia conquered — Trajan's Column commemorates this

key_locations.name: The Forum
key_locations.description: Center of civic, commercial, and religious life

social_structure._description: Who are the people, what are the hierarchies, what are the rules?
legal_facts: Women can own property but cannot vote
Slaves can be manumitted by owner's declaration

prices_and_costs._description: Specific prices ground responses in reality and prevent vague hallucination

daily_life.typical_day: Wake at dawn, Forum for business, baths in afternoon, dinner in evening

characters._description: Each character gets their own backstory. The grounded system uses this to answer character-specific questions correctly.

_schema.name: Full name
_schema.blind_spots: What they don't know or refuse to accept
